intro: Silene nutans var. vulgaris, commonly known as the nodding catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of the United States and Canada. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that open in the morning. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, and is often found in disturbed soils. Silene nutans var. vulgaris is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters.
